article:
The Options => Settings action allows to edit the configuration of the tool.
The configuration of the tool has two types of settings:
The General settings
The Schemas settings
The SPARQL settings
The Styles settings
The Packages settings
The yEd settings
"Auto Refresh": checked if the is refreshed when selecting an element
"Include Individuals": checked if individuals must be included in the result
"Show Relation Constraints": checked if cardinality constraints must be presented on data objects relations
"Show DataProperties types": checked if the types of DataProperties must be presented
"Show Indirect Relations": checked if the indirect relations are shown in the
"Show Alias": checked if the link between Alias Classes should be shown in the diagrams
"Show Commented Elements": checked if elements which have comments must be shown with a specific icon. See also for more information
"Add Thing Class": checked if the Thing class should be present
"Use built-in Schemas": checked if the browser must use built-in schemas
"Schemas Alternate Locations": allow to specify alternate locations for URIs imported in your Ontologies. See also for more information
"Add Prefix in SPARQL Requests": checked if the prefixes for the current schema must be automatically included in the SPARQL requests
"Default Base Prefix": the default base rpefix to use in the automatically included prefix if the base prefix of the schema is empty
"Width Padding" : the padding for the boxes widths
"Height Padding" : the padding for the boxes height
"Has Custom Styles": checked if the style of diagrams is customized
"Custom Styles": the file specifying the custom style of diagrams
"Show Packages": show when opening an OWL/RDF diagram
"Show Packages as Closed": show Packages as closed when opening an OWL/RDF diagram
"Show Packages in Packages View": show Packages in Packages View when opening an OWL/RDF diagram
"Has Packages Configuration": checked if there is a customized Packages configuration
"Packages Configuration": the file specifying the customized Packages configuration, see
"Has yEd exe directory": checked to set the directory of the graph tool
"yEd exe directory": the directory of the graph tool
